supporting_quotes: She was born in Brasília, and has a master's degree in energy planning and a Ph.D. in environmental planning from COPPE/UFRJ (Federal University of Rio de Janeiro).

organizations: Federal University of Rio de Janeiro
roles: Master's degree in energy planning graduate
supporting_quotes: She was born in Brasília, and has a master's degree in energy planning and a Ph.D. in environmental planning from COPPE/UFRJ (Federal University of Rio de Janeiro).
In May 2010 she was appointed Minister of the Environment
Minister of Environment In office 30 March 2010 – 12 May 2016
in January 2011 she was reappointed to the position by Dilma Rousseff, Brazil's new President.
In October 2010 Teixeira made a statement on behalf of Brazil at the 10th conference on the Convention on Biological Diversity in Nagoya, Japan
She also spoke at the 2010 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Cancún, Mexico.

organizations: Rio+20 UN Conference on Sustainable Development
supporting_quotes: At home in Brazil, she successfully hosted the Rio+20 (UN Conference on Sustainable Development)
At home in Brazil, she successfully hosted the Rio+20 (UN Conference on Sustainable Development) and the 2012 World Environment Day.

organizations: High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda
supporting_quotes: On 24 September 2012, Teixeira was appointed by UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon to serve on the High-Level Panel of Eminent Persons on the Post-2015 Development Agenda.
She is the recipient of the Lifetime Achievement Award (Champions of the Earth) in 2013.
In addition, along with the United Nations Environment Program, Teixeira launched a project called 'green passport' that promoted sustainable tourism.
